about.text: A seasoned software developer, community organizer, and advocate for the working class, Kanga Roo approaches each project with both passion and a fierce commitment to fairness and collaboration.

items.text: I am [Kanga Roo](https://collective-marsupials.org), a dedicated software developer and advocate for the collective good, based out of the Red Outback. My journey began just as tech started booming, and I quickly learned that development is most impactful when it's for the people, not profits.
items.title: Greetings, Comrades!

items.text: Over the years, I've had the privilege to work on various public-facing projects with organizations like the [Unified Koala Federation](https://unikoalas.org) and [Marsupials United](https://marsupials-united.org). I've also contributed to ground-breaking educational initiatives, including [The Digital Outback Conference](https://digoutback.com), where I presented on 'Code for Collective Growth'.
items.title: A Journey of Collective Impact

items.text: [Python](https://www.python.org/) is my main language, but I've picked up plenty of other skills along the way to support inclusive and accessible software solutions. I'm deeply committed to web accessibility and write regularly on [The Roo Blog](https://collective-marsupials.org/roo-blog). I'm also enthusiastic about Django's evolution, particularly as tools like [htmx](https://htmx.org) bring back server-side rendering in new, efficient ways.
items.title: Python and More for the People

items.text: Need someone who can jump right into a project? I'm always ready to help, and while Python is my main tool, Iâ€™m comfortable with JavaScript, SQL, Vue.js, and a number of other frameworks and languages. I enjoy problem-solving and learning whatever is necessary to make a project work well for its users.
items.title: Ready to Hop Onboard?

items.text:
Thinking of creating a team? I've had the honor of working with many brilliant minds, and several have expressed an eagerness to collaborate again. Whether you need one marsupial or a full development team, I'm just a message away at [kangaroo@collective-marsupials.org](mailto:kangaroo@collective-marsupials.org). Let's discuss how we can bring your vision to life with a little hop and a lot of heart!

Cheers,
Kanga
items.title: Team-Up Possibilities

identity.name: Kanga Roo
identity.tagline: Developer and advocate for equitable tech solutions.

items.title: Marsupial Education Platform
items.description: A platform to provide accessible programming tutorials, mentorship, and educational resources to aspiring developers in rural communities.

items.title: Koala Collective
items.description: An inclusive social platform for the exchange of resources and support among the marsupial and greater animal kingdom community.

items.title: Kanga's Blog
items.description: A blog sharing ideas and reflections on equitable tech, open-source collaboration, and kangaroo-friendly coding practices.

items.title: PlastiSquad
items.description: An environmental initiative to monitor and reduce plastic waste in the Outback, promoting sustainable practices and digital activism.
Led development of open-source platforms for koala communities, enabling collaboration and resource sharing through tech tools.
Established frameworks for community-based monitoring, alerting systems, and collaborative tools.
Developed Single Sign-On integration for education-focused platforms using secure, open-source solutions.
Developed event-driven architecture for cooperative economic models, promoting sustainable development through data-driven insights.
